file_content.text: Senator? I've disarmed the bomb.
Senator? We've disarmed the bomb.
The Rattataki aren't going anywhere.
Excellent. A crisis contained is a crisis controlled. I'll inform Colonel Hauer at once.
The Rattataki... are they gone? Is it safe?
I didn't think anyone could stand against the Blood of Talath. My thanks.
What's that? Is someone else there?
Who--? You! You're the one behind all this! You and your blasted war games!
Is there something you haven't told me?
Is this true, Senator?
Go on! Tell him! Show him the blood on your hands!
Go on! Tell her! Show her the blood on your hands!
Go on! Tell them! Show them the blood on your hands!
What are you talking about?
I'm sure he can tell you more than I. Assuming he doesn't lie about it.
You're crazy.
Don't believe me? Just ask him about his experiment!
That's enough! I'm a member of the Republic Senate. I don't answer to the likes of you.
Colonel Hauer and I were overseeing a military exercise of sorts--Project Noble Focus.
We tested prisoners of varying species against one other and analyzed the results. All entirely consensual.
Lies! They promised us our freedom if we participated, but it never ended. All we got was more killing, more bloodshed.
This is a serious abuse of your power, Senator.
This shouldn't have happened.
How could you possibly condone something like this?
This is reprehensible.
I don't like going into battle without all the facts, Senator.
You kept this from me, Tudos.
Surely you're no stranger to classified information, Major.
And here I thought all the scum around here were behind bars.
Cold, even for a politician.
Everything I did, I did for the good of the Republic. Surely a few prisoners' lives don't outweigh that?
What was the point of all these experiments?
Why do this?
We wanted to see how the different species fared under duress. Some performed quite well, others... not so.
Consider it your punishment.
If the Republic wanted us dead, they should have just executed us and been done with it.
The Rattataki were the first to escape... led by that animal, Sulkhaz. They prepared, waited for the Imperials to free the rest of us.
We were out of our cells, but we couldn't leave the wing--and the Rattataki knew it. They've been massacring us ever since.
The Rattataki are a dangerous bunch. You're lucky to be alive.
Must have been rough.
I doubt my luck will hold if I stay here.
How have you survived the Rattataki all this time?
Have you been hiding?
I... hid. After they killed my fellows, I tried tunneling my way out.
Don't care.
The Senator's war games have consumed the Rattataki completely. They won't stop until they've killed everyone.
Don't waste your time with filth like him. He made his bed; now he can lie in it.
You'll be safe in the minimum security wing. I can tell you how to get there....
I'm still going to help him.
I didn't expect to find any decency in this accursed place. Thank you!
If you're done fraternizing with prisoners, we could use you back at the base. There are new developments.
Colonel Hauer can fill you in when you get here. We'll talk more then.
Bad things happen to criminals. Say hi to the Rattataki for me.
Go off and die, prisoner scum.
When the Blood of Talath find me, it is your face I shall curse.
When the Blood of Talath find me, it is your faces I shall curse.
If you're done fraternizing with prisoners, we could use you back at the base. There are new developments.
Colonel Hauer can fill you in when you get here. We'll talk more then.
They will tear me to pieces if I stay here any longer. But there is no escape. Help me.
They will tear me to pieces if I stay, but there is no escape--Sulkhaz has followers not just in this cell block, but everywhere. Help me.
